inside.translation[0].definitions[0].def: in or into a container or other closed space so as to be completely covered or surrounded
inside.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: The jewels were locked away inside the safe.
I sent the money inside an envelope addressed to Ann.
Carl picked up the book and stuffed it inside his jacket.
Her car was locked and the keys were inside.
inside.translation[0].definitions[1].def: in or into a building or room
inside.translation[0].definitions[1].exa: It’s raining. We’ll have to go inside.
She could hear voices inside, but no one came to the door.
Mail was piled up just inside the doorway.
The sound was coming from inside the house.
There were 20 people packed inside of her dorm room.
inside.translation[0].definitions[2].def: in a country or area – used when you want to emphasize that something is happening there and not in other places
inside.translation[0].definitions[2].exa: Very little is known of events inside this mysterious country.
The guerrillas were said to be operating from bases inside the war zone.
inside.translation[0].definitions[3].def: if someone is inside a group or organization, they are part of it
inside.translation[0].definitions[3].exa: The information comes from sources inside the company.
Discussions should involve local people both inside and outside the school.
inside.translation[0].definitions[4].def: if something happens inside you, or inside your head or mind, it is part of what you think and feel, especially when you do not express it
inside.translation[0].definitions[4].exa: You just don’t understand how I feel inside!
Steve’s a strange guy – you never know what’s going on inside his head.
Anger bubbled up deep inside her.
Something inside of me told me not to trust him.
inside.translation[0].definitions[5].exa: She could feel the baby kicking inside her.
You’ll feel better once you’ve got a good meal inside you  (=after you have eaten something).
inside.translation[0].definitions[6].def: in less than a particular amount of time
inside.translation[0].definitions[6].exa: A full report is expected inside three months.
We’ll be back inside the hour.
Our aim is to get the whole job finished inside of a week.
inside.translation[0].definitions[7].def: less than a particular amount of time
inside.translation[0].definitions[7].exa: Jonson’s time of 9.3 seconds was just inside the world record.
inside.translation[0].definitions[8].exa: My boyfriend’s been inside for a year.
inside.translation[2].definitions[0].def: in or facing the inner part of something
inside.translation[2].definitions[0].exa: the inside pages of the newspaper
the inside pocket of his jacket
inside.translation[3].definitions[0].def: someone inside a company or organization works for it and is part of it
inside.translation[3].definitions[0].exa: He had obviously been helped by someone inside the company.
She made enemies both inside and outside the industry.
inside.translation[4].definitions[0].def: inside knowledge, information etc is possessed by or comes from someone working for the company or organization it relates to
inside.translation[4].definitions[0].exa: someone who trades on an inside stock tip
inside.translation[4].definitions[1].exa: The leading inside candidate for the post is Robert A. Lutz.
